III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the
following:
The facility is not contracted with the DHHS and not subject to ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not
be included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
The facility is not contracted with the DHHS and not subject to DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was no offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(1) The licensee shall provide an orientation program for new
employees. Job shadowing shall not be the only form of
orientation. The orientation shall include the following:
(a) The institution's purpose, policies, and procedures,
including discipline, crisis intervention techniques, and
emergency and safety procedures.
One out of one new employee record’s reviewed did not contain the First Week
Respite Home Orientation form. Documentation of orientation as occurring was
verified on the agency-wide New Orientation form. Best practice is to be consistent
with orientation documentation throughout all employee records.
4

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The 09/29/2020 interim inspection cited the
facility for chief administrator responsibilities to include completing an annual
assessment of compliance with licensing rules and a plan to correct. The corrective
action plan was successful as this is not a repeat citation.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
